thread.title: England’s start XI v Germany if based purely on Premier League form
thread.title_full: England’s start XI v Germany if based purely on Premier League form

author: Simon Rice
title: England’s start XI v Germany if based purely on Premier League form
text:
Southgate has some decisions to make (Getty) Gareth Southgate will be selecting his first ever England squad as permanent manager on Wednesday.
The Three Lions take on Germany in Dortmund and everyone will be paying close attention to see what the team and performance suggests we can expect from the new England manager with little more than a year to the World Cup in Russia.
Time for a reality check: Arsenal is as good as it's going to get for Mesut Ozil Southgate already made something of a statement by not selecting Theo Walcott and giving call-ups to uncapped trioÂ Nathan Redmond, James Ward-Prowse and Michael Keane.
Will he continue to surprise with his starting XI against Germany?
If he picked his team based purely on form in the Premier League itâ€™d certainly raise a few eyebrows â€“ even if it were based on cold, hard data. With the help of Oulala.com , whoâ€™ve crunched the numbers, weâ€™ve put together a team based on exactly that.
Here it isâ€Ś 
 
It would mean no place for Man City exile Joe Hart between the posts. Based on his performance at the weekend though, that might not be a bad idea.
There would be an England debut for Burnleyâ€™s Michael Keane, but no place for his fellow international virgins.
Meanwhile veteran striker Jermain Defoe, back in the squad due to injuries to Harry Kane, Wayne Rooney and Daniel Sturridge, would be the favoured choice in attack.
England squad to face Germany Goalkeepers:Â Fraser Forster (Southampton), Joe Hart (Torino, on loan from Man City), Tom Heaton (Burnley).
Defenders:Â Ryan Bertrand (Southampton), Gary Cahill (Chelsea), Nathaniel Clyne (Liverpool), Michael Keane (Burnley), Luke Shaw (Man Utd), Chris Smalling (Man Utd), John Stones (Man City), Kyle Walker (Tottenham).
Midfielders: Â Dele Alli (Tottenham), Ross Barkley (Everton), Eric Dier (Tottenham), Adam Lallana (Liverpool), Jesse Lingard (Man Utd), Jake Livermore (West Brom), Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain (Arsenal), Nathan Redmond (Southampton), Raheem Sterling (Man City), James Ward-Prowse (Southampton).
Strikers:Â Jermain Defoe (Sunderland), Marcus Rashford (Man Utd), Jamie Vardy (Leicester).
Michail Antonio (West Ham) and Phil Jones (Man Utd) have withdrawn. 
More: Football Arsene Wenger breaks silence over reports of PSG's contract offer 
Europa League star: This is why I rejected Liverpool in January 
Arsenal star admits the players don't know how to solve their set-piece problems 
We’ll find out the real team an hour before Wednesday’s 7.45pm kick off.
MORE: Manchester United defender Phil Jones withdraws from England squad with injury 
MORE: Germany v England preview: Gareth Southgate gets to work with the World Cup looming 
Stats provided by Oulala.com , the daily fantasy football game.
